result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek W Langan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Unattended Vehicle. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 04-01-2016 or serve 13 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek W Langan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has paid up front restitution.  The State moves to amend to county ordinance Hit and Run unattended vehicle 346.68.  The Court amends the charge accordingly.  A no contest plea is entered and the Court finds the defendant guilty.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows:
FINE: $607.50 (defendant to pay $100.00 per month commencing 4/1/16, or serve 13 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Sonderhouse advises the Court working on a resolution with involves up front payment of restitution.  Attorney Sonderhouse to advise how case will proceed at the next hearing.   Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Sonderhouse is provided restitution request in Court by the State.  Attorney Sonderhouse requests the Court set the matter out in two weeks to review status of case.  Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court, in custody, with attorney Zachary Hoff for Ronald James Sonderhouse.    Attorney David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No discovery yet. Parties to let know how case will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Derek W Langan in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
